page.title: 13Mixed Farming:Hillside Farm
page.content: Mr. and Mrs. Oliver live at Hillside Farm. The 300 acre farm is divided into 50 fields for arable. They have 130 Hereford cross{cattle}for beef and 400{ewes.} He has approximately 5 tractors, 3 ploughs, 3 rollers and 1 power harrow, and 2 labourers (his son, his wife and 1 employed man help run the farm). The farm produces 100 tons of{wheat} per year and the livestock are sold at Hereford, Kidderminster and Gloucester. The livestock provide manure for fertilising the arable fields which protects the structure of the soil. The cattle in winter feed on silage, barley and oats, while in summer they go on the meadows. This farm is not typical of the area as most are dairy farms. The farm house is georgian.
